conclusion: Points A and B have equal magnitude like charges. The electric field strength at the center O is E. The electric potential at O is not given, but the potential at infinity is 0.

premise: Points A and B have like charges.
conclusion: The electric fields they produce at O will be equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.

premise: The electric fields from A and B are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
conclusion: The net electric field at O due to charges at A and B is E.
The potential at O due to a single charge q at a distance r is V = kq/r.

premise: A and B are equidistant from O.
conclusion: The potential at O due to each charge is the same.

premise: The potentials at O due to charges at A and B are the same.
conclusion: The total potential at O is the sum of the potentials due to charges at A and B.
An equal magnitude opposite sign charge is placed at C.

premise: An opposite sign charge is placed at C.
conclusion: This charge will produce an electric field at O that is equal in magnitude to the fields produced by charges at A and B, but in a different direction.

premise: The electric field due to the charge at C is equal in magnitude to E.
conclusion: The vector sum of the fields from A and B will be canceled out by the field from C.

premise: The vector sum of the fields from A and B is canceled by the field from C.
conclusion: The net electric field at O will be zero.

premise: The potential at O due to the charge at C is the negative of the potential due to the charges at A and B.
conclusion: The potential at O will be the sum of the potentials due to all three charges.

premise: The potential due to the charges at A and B will cancel out.
conclusion: The potential at O is the negative of the initial potential due to the charges at A and B.

premise: The net electric field at O is zero and the potential is the negative of the initial potential.
conclusion: The magnitude of the electric field strength at O is 0, and the electric potential at O is the negative of the initial potential.
